summary: A CIA document, dated November 26, 1963, contains an assessment by the Brazilian Ambassador regarding the likely foreign and domestic policies of the Johnson Administration following President Kennedy's assassination.
summary_one_paragraph: This Top Secret CIA document from November 26, 1963, reveals the Brazilian Ambassador's assessment of President Lyndon B. Johnson's administration. The ambassador predicts continuity in foreign policy in the short term but anticipates a shift towards a less rigid stance with Western Europe (especially France) and a more conservative approach to domestic policy, characterized by compromise with Congress on major bills. The ambassador also suggests Johnson's close ties with Congress and his Southern background could aid in legislative approval, though he expects pressure from the Democratic Party's liberal wing to prevent radical change.
title: Brazilian Ambassador Assesses Johnson Administration
